meaning: She is the treasure house of wisdom and experience (vijnana, anubhava).
commentary: The word ‘Jnana’ refers to knowledge, ‘Vijnāna’ refers to wisdom learnt through experience. Bringing that knowledge (Jnana) to use through practical experience is Vijnāna. A Jnani selects that knowledge which is most dear to him/her and transforms it into experience. With the resultant wisdom, He is a Vijnāni.
